analyzed: mkhyen pa de yang sgrub bar byed pa dang bcas pa de yang gsung ba'i don du mngon par sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin te //

original: gang gi phyir rgyu bzhi po des na de tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu bzhi po des na de tshad ma nyid do //

original: 'dis ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: dong po yi ni tha ma yin la /
analyzed: dong po yi ni tha ma yin la /

analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das tshad ma yin no zhes nges par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the BhagavƒÅn is valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan 'di nyid kyis bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan 'di nyid kyis bstod pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the BhagavƒÅn is praised by this characteristic of valid cognition.

original: des bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des bshad pa ni /
translated: That is explained:

original: de lta'i dngos po bstod pa ni //
analyzed: de lta'i dngos po bstod pa ni //

original: de yi bstan pa nyid las ni //
analyzed: de yi bstan pa nyid las ni //

original: tshad ma'i de nyid grub don te //
analyzed: tshad ma'i de nyid grub don te //
translated: The purpose of establishing the reality of valid cognition

original: rjes su dpag pa ma bzlog phyir //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ma bzlog phyir //

original: cung zad skye ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: cung zad skye ba'i bdag nyid can //

analyzed: gang de thams cad 'gog chos can // zhes sogs rnam pa du mar ni //
translated: All of that is a phenomenon of cessation.

original: 'di yi sbyor ba mthong phyir ro /üîΩci'i phyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de lta bu'i dngos po nye bar ston ce na /
analyzed: 'di yi sbyor ba mthong phyir ro / ci'i phyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de lta bu'i dngos po nye bar ston ce na /
translated: Because the application of this is seen in many ways.üîΩWhy is the definition of valid knowledge taught in that way?

original: de'i nye bar ston pa nyid las tshad ma'i de kho na nyid ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar ston pa nyid las tshad ma'i de kho na nyid ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur bar bya ba'i don du'o //

original: de las mngon sum ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa yin te ;
analyzed: de las mngon sum ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa yin te ;
translated: Among those, direct perception is taught by the BhagavƒÅn.

original: sngon po shes pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bus ni sngon po shes kyi /
analyzed: sngon po shes pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bus ni sngon po shes kyi /
translated: A person who has the consciousness of blue knows blue,

analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma bzlog ste /

original: de'i phyir bzhed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhed pa nyid do //

analyzed: sgra las byung ba la sogs pa dag ni bzlog ste /

original: pha rol rab tu smra ba thams cad ni gsog ste /
analyzed: pha rol rab tu smra ba thams cad ni gsog ste /
translated: All the philosophies of others are false.
I alone

original: gcig pu de nyid gsungs pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gcig pu de nyid gsungs pa yin no zhes so //
translated: teach reality.

original: yang na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid sbyor ba bstan pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid sbyor ba bstan pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the definition of inference for the sake of others is taught by the syllogism.

original: ji skad du gang cung zad skye ba'i bdag nyid can de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du gang cung zad skye ba'i bdag nyid can de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúWhatever has the nature of arising is necessarily characterized by cessation.‚Äù

original: de nyid smras pa ni /üîΩmed na mi 'byung mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: de nyid smras pa ni / med na mi 'byung mtshan nyid can //
translated: He himself states that:

original: rtags ni rjes dpag rten yin no //
analyzed: rtags ni rjes dpag rten yin no //
translated: The reason is the basis of inferenceüîΩWhich has the nature of being an invariable mark.

original: bsgrub byas gtan tshigs khyab pa ni //
analyzed: bsgrub byas gtan tshigs khyab pa ni //
translated: The pervasion of the reason by the probandum

original: bstan phyir de yang gsal bar bshad //
analyzed: bstan phyir de yang gsal bar bshad //
translated: Is taught, and that is clearly explained.

original: bsgrub byas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs ni go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub byas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs ni go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: The reason pervaded by the probandum is the means of understanding.

original: gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa de yang gang cung zad kyang cung zad skye ba'i bdag nyid can de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa du mar bstan par mdzad de /

translated: And the pervasion of the reason is taught in many ways by the Bhagavat, ‚ÄúWhatever has the nature of arising is necessarily characterized by cessation.‚Äù

original: des na rjes su dpag pa yang gsung ba nyid kyis tshad ma'i de kho na nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dang po bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa yang gsung ba nyid kyis tshad ma'i de kho na nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dang po bstan pa yin la /

original: de yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: And it is valid cognition,

original: des na dang por smos pa'i tshad ma nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis yon tan dam pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dang por smos pa'i tshad ma nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis yon tan dam pa yin no //
translated: so the valid cognition that is first mentioned is the highest quality of the Lord Buddha.

original: gang phyir gnyis ldan tshad ma'i de nyid ni //
analyzed: gang phyir gnyis ldan tshad ma'i de nyid ni //
translated: The reality of valid cognition, which has two aspects,

original: bcom ldan de bzhin bshegs pas bstan mdzad pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan de bzhin bshegs pas bstan mdzad pa //
translated: was taught by the Lord, the Tathagata.

original: de phyir de las tshad ma gzhan yod min //
analyzed: de phyir de las tshad ma gzhan yod min //
translated: Therefore, there is no valid cognition other than that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di las thams cad grub //üîΩtshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di las thams cad grub // tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan las /
translated: Everything is established from the Tathagata.

original: tshad ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Establishment of Valid Cognition,‚ÄùüîΩfrom the Ornament of the Middle Way, a commentary on the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: // / de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa /
translated: Having described the general characteristics, now the specific characteristics will be explained.

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag tshad ma yin no //
translated: Direct perception and inference are valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma de yang mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma de yang mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that valid cognition is nondeceptive.

original: mi slu ba yang don las skyes pas don la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba yang don las skyes pas don la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it is nondeceptive because it arises from an object and is not mistaken with regard to the object.

original: gal te don la mi 'khrul pa de nyid ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don la mi 'khrul pa de nyid ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is that nondeception understood?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis te /
translated: It is understood through perception and inference.

original: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: It is not a valid cognition because it is perception and because it is inference.

original: gzhan sgra las byung ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan sgra las byung ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a valid cognition because it is derived from another, such as verbal testimony.

original: gal te sgra las byung ba la sogs pa don dang 'brel pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba gang las she na /
analyzed: gal te sgra las byung ba la sogs pa don dang 'brel pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba gang las she na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow do you know that that which is derived from verbal testimony and so on is not related to an object?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid gnyis ni gzhal bya yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid gnyis ni gzhal bya yin la /
translated: The reason is that the two characteristics are objects of comprehension.

original: tshad ma ni gzhal bya la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni gzhal bya la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A valid cognition is not mistaken with regard to the object of comprehension.

original: gzhal bya med na ni gzhal bya la mi 'khrul bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya med na ni gzhal bya la mi 'khrul bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object of comprehension does not exist, it is not nonmistaken with regard to the object of comprehension.

original: @155b gzhal bya yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @155b gzhal bya yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of comprehension is also not other than what is to be realized by direct perception and inference.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya ni med do zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya ni med do zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that there is no object of comprehension other than the characteristics of the particular and the universal.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul yin la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul yin la /
translated: The particular characteristic is the object of direct perception.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The universal characteristic is the object of inference.

original: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni /
translated: This is taught by the following.

original: gzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
translated: There are two valid cognitions because there are two objects of comprehension.

original: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
analyzed: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
translated: Because of being able to perform a function or not,

original: skra shad la sogs don min te //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs don min te //
translated: a false object such as floating hairs and so on does not exist,

original: don du mos pa med phyir ro //üîΩmngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i dbye bas tshad ma ni rnam pa gnyis kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: don du mos pa med phyir ro // mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i dbye bas tshad ma ni rnam pa gnyis kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: because it is not conceived to be a real object.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhal bya rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhal bya rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It should be understood that valid knowledge is of two types alone, divided into direct perception and inference, because if that were not so, it would be untenable that the object of comprehension is realized.

original: mngon sum rjes su dpag bya yin //
analyzed: mngon sum rjes su dpag bya yin //
translated: Direct perception is to be inferred.

original: rnam pa las gzhan rtogs med pa //üîΩde phyir de las gzhan pa yi //
analyzed: rnam pa las gzhan rtogs med pa // de phyir de las gzhan pa yi //
translated: There is no cognition apart from the form.üîΩTherefore, we do not accept

original: tshad ma yod par 'dod ma yin //üîΩmngon sum dang rjes su dpag par bya ba dag kho na dag phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i gzhal bya yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma yod par 'dod ma yin // mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par bya ba dag kho na dag phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i gzhal bya yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: that there is a valid cognition apart from that.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo yin pas rtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyul gcig nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo yin pas rtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro // yul gcig nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Only direct perception and inference are the objects of valid cognition that are unmistakenly cognized, but not others, because there is no other form of cognition apart from the form of the cognition of a universal and a particular.

original: rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And even a single object would become two, because there are two forms of cognition.

original: rtogs pa'i dbye ba yang tshad ma'i dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dbye ba yang tshad ma'i dbye ba yin te /
translated: And the division of cognition is the division of valid cognition,

original: de nyid ni yul gyi dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni yul gyi dbye ba yin no //
translated: and that itself is the division of the object.

original: gal te rtogs pa'i bye brag yul gyi dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur te gzhan tha dad pas gzhan tha dad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i bye brag yul gyi dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur te gzhan tha dad pas gzhan tha dad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the division of cognition is the division of the object, how could it be so? It is not that one thing is different because another is different.

original: de ni bden te /üîΩrta yi dbye bas ba sogs kyi //
analyzed: de ni bden te / rta yi dbye bas ba sogs kyi //
translated: That is true.üîΩThe nature of cows, etc.

original: ngo bo tha dad 'gyur min te //
analyzed: ngo bo tha dad 'gyur min te //
translated: is not different due to the difference of horses.

original: 'brel med phyir ro shes pa dang // shes bya dag ni de ltar min //
analyzed: 'brel med phyir ro shes pa dang // shes bya dag ni de ltar min //
translated: Because they are not related, consciousness and the object of consciousness are not like that.

original: don rnams yod med nges pa yi //
analyzed: don rnams yod med nges pa yi //
translated: The ascertainment of the existence or nonexistence of objects

original: rnam gzhag shes la rag las yin //üîΩshes gzhan las ni don de nyid //
analyzed: rnam gzhag shes la rag las yin // shes gzhan las ni don de nyid //
translated: depends on the knowledge of their presentation.üîΩThe very object is known from another knowledge

original: don gzhan nyid du shes par byed //
analyzed: don gzhan nyid du shes par byed //
translated: that is different from the object.

original: gang gi tshe shes pa skyed pa la dngos su nus pa nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa skyed pa la dngos su nus pa nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When it is directly understood to be capable of producing consciousness,

original: 'dir rang gi ngo bos mtshan pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi ngo bos mtshan pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: then it is a particular characteristic, because it is characterized by its own nature.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid brgyud pas nus pa nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe ni /üîΩspyi'i ngo bor mtshon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid brgyud pas nus pa nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe ni / spyi'i ngo bor mtshon pa'i phyir /
translated: When it is understood to be capable of producing consciousness indirectly,

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: then it is a universal characteristic, because it is characterized by a universal nature.

original: ma yin par 'jug pas brgyud pas nus pa nyid nus pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ma yin par 'jug pas brgyud pas nus pa nyid nus pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that the indirect capability of producing consciousness is not capable of producing consciousness,

original: @156a * // gtan nus pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @156a * // gtan nus pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not capable of producing consciousness directly.

original: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa dang / skra la sogs pa las dmigs pa ni don med pa nyid de /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa dang / skra la sogs pa las dmigs pa ni don med pa nyid de /
translated: The object of the visual consciousness that perceives floating hairs and so on and the object of the visual consciousness that perceives real hairs and so on are not different.

original: dngos sam brgyud pas nus par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos sam brgyud pas nus par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not understand that it is capable of being either directly or indirectly related to the object.

original: don du nus pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don du nus pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not capable of being related to the object.

original: mos pa med pa yang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa med pa yang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the absence of conviction is due to the operation of a valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: 'di las kyang gzhal bya gnyis yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang gzhal bya gnyis yin te /
translated: The two kinds of objects are also established from this verse:

original: 'dra dang mi 'dra nyid phyir dang // sgra yi yul dang yul min phyir //
analyzed: 'dra dang mi 'dra nyid phyir dang // sgra yi yul dang yul min phyir //
translated: Because of similarity and dissimilarity, and because of the object and nonobject of sound.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa na //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa na //
translated: When there is another reason,

original: blo ni yod dang med phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni yod dang med phyir ro //
translated: the cognition is either existent or nonexistent.

original: gang zhig rnam pa ci zhig ltar 'dra ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa ci zhig ltar 'dra ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: That which is understood as having a similar nature in some way is the universal.

original: gzhan du rtogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du rtogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That which is understood as different is the particular.

original: gal te mdun na gnas pa'i ba lang la sogs pa'i 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa dang / de bzhin du ba men de ni 'di yin no zhes nye bar 'jal bas rtogs pa de ci ga spyi'i mtshan nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mdun na gnas pa'i ba lang la sogs pa'i 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa dang / de bzhin du ba men de ni 'di yin no zhes nye bar 'jal bas rtogs pa de ci ga spyi'i mtshan nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the universal is understood as the similar nature of a cow that is present in front, and if the particular is understood as the determination that this is a cow, then is that the universal?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du ni //üîΩgang la shes pa skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du ni // gang la shes pa skye 'gyur ba //
translated: But in the nature of a likeness,üîΩThe cognition arises.üîΩ

original: de ni spyi yi mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: de ni spyi yi mtshan nyid yin //
translated: But the universal is the object of a cognition that arises in the form of that.üîΩHere, the cognition is of the individual thing itself.

original: 'dir ni rang gi ngo bos rig / gang zhig 'dra ba'i ngo bo kho nar rtogs pa de spyi yin na /
analyzed: 'dir ni rang gi ngo bos rig / gang zhig 'dra ba'i ngo bo kho nar rtogs pa de spyi yin na /
translated: If the universal is the object of a cognition that arises in the form of that,

original: 'dir ni khyad par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni khyad par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: here the cognition is of the individual thing itself.

original: gal te 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du yang rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du yang rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the universal is the object of a cognition that arises in the form of that, which is similar to that,

original: tha dad par de'i ngo bor rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par de'i ngo bor rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de med par yang mngon sum ni //

original: 'di ltar 'di de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni don gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni don gcig pa yin la /

analyzed: de'i rjes su byed pa'i bya ba yang gnyi ga las dmigs pa yin no //

analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni gnyi ga rtogs par mi nus te /

analyzed: des na 'dra ba ni sgra'i spyod yul du gyur pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the similarity is the object of the word and is to be understood by means of the natural inference.

original: de ni 'di dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'di'i rnam pa de la yang mthong ba'i phyir dang / 'dra ba'i tha snyad tsam de la yang sgrub pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i rnam pa gnyis ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum dag kho nas dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Because the form of that is seen in this, because the mere designation of similarity is established in that, and because the two forms that are the basis for the cognition of that kind are perceived only by the prior and subsequent direct perceptions.

original: de'i phyir sgra'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of the word is not the particular.

original: sgra smos pas ni rnam par rtog pa nyid mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra smos pas ni rnam par rtog pa nyid mtshon pa yin te /
translated: By mentioning the word, conceptualization is indicated.

original: rnam par rtog pa yul yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yul yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: gang la rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa na blo med par zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi dmigs pa 'phen pa yin te /

original: gang la blo med pa de ni med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la blo med pa de ni med pa yin no //

original: de la blo 'ga' zhig la shes pa 'jug pa na /
analyzed: de la blo 'ga' zhig la shes pa 'jug pa na /

original: da ni gzhan la ma zhugs so zhes rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni gzhan la ma zhugs so zhes rtogs pa yin te /

original: nges pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: des na thams cad du bdag nyid 'jug pa ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad du bdag nyid 'jug pa ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self-cognition that occurs in all cases is not the objective support.

analyzed: des na mngon sum nyid kyis tha dad par smra ba'i dngos po rnam pa gnyis rtogs pa yin te /

original: rtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba la sogs pa 'di thams cad ni lkog tu gyur pa dang / cig shos kyi rtogs pa'i spyod yul yin la /
analyzed: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba la sogs pa 'di thams cad ni lkog tu gyur pa dang / cig shos kyi rtogs pa'i spyod yul yin la /

original: de yang don byed pa nus pa dang mi nus pa la shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang don byed pa nus pa dang mi nus pa la shes pa yin no //

original: 'di yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro //

original: gang la nga ni med pa @160a * //
analyzed: gang la nga ni med pa @160a * //

original: de ; / ngas gsal mngon sum las gzhan yin //
analyzed: de ; / ngas gsal mngon sum las gzhan yin //

original: 'di tsam nyid kyi don rnams kyis //
analyzed: 'di tsam nyid kyi don rnams kyis //

analyzed: lkog gyur nyid ni nges pa nyid // nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi //

analyzed: mngon sum bdag nyid rig pa nyid //

original: nges pa nyid du rtogs nyid ni //
analyzed: nges pa nyid du rtogs nyid ni //

analyzed: gzhan pa lkog gyur rtogs pa yin // lkog gyur nyid ni mngon sum gyis //

original: rtogs kyang don gyi ngo bo ni //üîΩlkog gyur nyid de de don la //
analyzed: rtogs kyang don gyi ngo bo ni // lkog gyur nyid de de don la //

analyzed: mngon sum 'jug pa yod ma yin // mngon sum don shes med par ni //

analyzed: lkog nyid ji ltar rig par byed //

original: de rig na ni de yi chos //
analyzed: de rig na ni de yi chos //

analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'gyur rtogs par 'gyur //

analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi rtogs pa stong ba tsam yin pas de ni chos can 'dzin pa la mi ltos so //

analyzed: ci ste lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum mi 'jug na rjes su dpag pa ji ltar 'jug ce na /

analyzed: 'di ni cung zad kyang ma yin te / 'di ltar / rjes su dpag pas dngos po de'i //

original: lkog gyur nyid ni sgrub mi byed ;
analyzed: lkog gyur nyid ni sgrub mi byed ;
translated: the imperceptible of that entity.

original: / mngon sum nyid du 'gyur na yang //
analyzed: / mngon sum nyid du 'gyur na yang //

analyzed: mthong ba'i ngo bo sgrub pa yin //

analyzed: de la ni sngar mngon sum zhugs pa nyid do //

analyzed: de yi lkog tu gyur pa nyid //

original: de yi shugs kyis gnas pa yin //
analyzed: de yi shugs kyis gnas pa yin //
translated: is established by implication.

analyzed: de'i ngo bo la rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa mi nus pa 'di nyid lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin la /

analyzed: dngos dang 'brel pa tsam gyis ni //

analyzed: shes pa tshad mar brjod pa yin // dngos po dang ni 'brel pa yi //

analyzed: des na rgyu las 'bras bu ji ltar 'grub ba ce na /

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: gang phyir tshogs pa yod gyur na //

analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu skye 'gyur pa // de phyir 'bras bu rgyu las ni //

analyzed: mi rigs pas ni ji ltar 'gyur //

analyzed: gal te yang gdon mi za bar rgyu ni 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs mod kyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir rgyu las 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ba nyid do //

analyzed: yul gzhan med pas khyad par byed pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan log par bsgrub pa yin no //

original: gzhal bya dang bral ba'i tshad ma ni med de /

analyzed: mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur ma yin // 'o na rjes su dpag pa las //
translated: It is not the case that direct perception engagesüîΩThe effect of the change of state of the prior and subsequent moments.üîΩWell, then, since the effect is known prior to the cause

original: 'bras bu'i sngon du rgyu rig pas //üîΩde las shes pa 'di skyes zhes //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sngon du rgyu rig pas // de las shes pa 'di skyes zhes //
translated: Through inference,üîΩOne would know the effect, thinking,

original: 'bras bu nyid du shes 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du shes 'gyur na //
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness has arisen from that.‚Äù

original: rjes dpag de yang mngon sum gyis //üîΩrab tu rtogs pa med pa yi //
analyzed: rjes dpag de yang mngon sum gyis // rab tu rtogs pa med pa yi //
translated: But that inferenceüîΩDoes not engage with the thing

original: dngos la 'jug pa yod min zhes //
analyzed: dngos la 'jug pa yod min zhes //
translated: Without the direct perception of the effect.

original: sngar nyid rab tu bstan zin to //
analyzed: sngar nyid rab tu bstan zin to //
translated: This has already been taught earlier.

original: sngon rol mngon sum tshad med na //
analyzed: sngon rol mngon sum tshad med na //
translated: If there is no direct valid knowledge prior to it,

analyzed: rjes dpag tshad mar 'gyur ma yin // de @163a * // la sngon rol rjes dpag nyid //
translated: Inference is not a valid knowledge.üîΩIf you say that there is inference prior to it,

original: yod do zhe na thug thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: yod do zhe na thug thug med 'gyur //
translated: There would be an infinite regress.

original: 'bras sogs gzhal bya re zhig zhog //
analyzed: 'bras sogs gzhal bya re zhig zhog //
translated: Put aside for a while such objects of evaluation as rice.

original: gang la de yod de rtogs med //
analyzed: gang la de yod de rtogs med //
translated: How can one understand that which does not exist?

original: gzhi med skyed 'grub med pa bzhin //
analyzed: gzhi med skyed 'grub med pa bzhin //
translated: It is like the non-establishment of a non-existent basis.

original: chos grub chos can med mi 'thad //
analyzed: chos grub chos can med mi 'thad //
translated: It is not tenable that a property-possessor is established without a property.

original: shes pa dmigs dang bcas gyur na //
analyzed: shes pa dmigs dang bcas gyur na //
translated: If consciousness were to have an object,

original: dngos po rab tu 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po rab tu 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: then entities would be well established.

original: gang tshe dngos po grub med pa //
analyzed: gang tshe dngos po grub med pa //
translated: But when entities are not established,

original: de tshe gang zhig rgyu 'bras yin //
analyzed: de tshe gang zhig rgyu 'bras yin //

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du ji ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du ji ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: How is it that it is not established as having an object?üîΩIt is said:

original: brjod pa / 'gro 'dir rgyu nyid dmigs par ni //
analyzed: brjod pa / 'gro 'dir rgyu nyid dmigs par ni //
translated: In this world, a cause is observed,

original: 'gyur gyi snang ba tsam gyis min //
analyzed: 'gyur gyi snang ba tsam gyis min //
translated: but not merely an appearance.

original: snang ba tsam gyis yin na ni //
analyzed: snang ba tsam gyis yin na ni //
translated: If it were merely an appearance,

original: rab rib can blo'ang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab rib can blo'ang der 'gyur ro //

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa //
translated: That which is the cause of something

original: de med par ni de med pas //
analyzed: de med par ni de med pas //
translated: does not exist without it.

original: mig sogs blo yang dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: mig sogs blo yang dmigs pa ni //
translated: Therefore, even the cognition of the eye and so forth

original: med na gnas par mi 'gyur 'thob //
analyzed: med na gnas par mi 'gyur 'thob //
translated: is not established as abiding without an object.

original: zla gnyis rnam can mig sogs shes //
analyzed: zla gnyis rnam can mig sogs shes //
translated: The cognition of the eye and so forth with the aspect of two moons

original: dmigs pa med kyang skye bar mthong //
analyzed: dmigs pa med kyang skye bar mthong //
translated: is seen to arise even without an object.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rgyu med kyang skye bar mthong bas 'khrul pa'i phyir na dmigs pa ni rgyu yin pa dang rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu yin par mi 'gyur bar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rgyu med kyang skye bar mthong bas 'khrul pa'i phyir na dmigs pa ni rgyu yin pa dang rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu yin par mi 'gyur bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, since it is seen that consciousness arises without an objective cause, it is illogical that the object is the cause and consciousness is the effect because of error.

original: 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te /
translated: This is the nature of cause and effect.

original: phan tshun tha dad par gyur pa na khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad par gyur pa na khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i gang yin pa'o //
translated: When they are mutually different, one is the pervaded and the other is the pervader.

original: rgyur 'dod pa med par 'bras bu 'dod pa yod na ni de de'i rgyu ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyur 'dod pa med par 'bras bu 'dod pa yod na ni de de'i rgyu ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin no //
translated: If the effect is asserted without the cause being asserted, then it is not its cause and it is not an effect.

original: des na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dngos po mtha' dag ma grub pas rgyud dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ga la yod /
analyzed: des na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dngos po mtha' dag ma grub pas rgyud dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, since all things are not established because of the nonexistence of the object, how could there be the nature of a continuum and an effect?

original: ci ste rgyu nyid kyis ni dmigs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu nyid kyis ni dmigs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the cause is not the object but rather the object is the object of apprehension,

original: de ltar yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ltar yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that also is untenable.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / sngon po la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sngon po la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i //
translated: Without apprehending blue and so on,

original: gzung ba gzhan ni gang na'ang med //
analyzed: gzung ba gzhan ni gang na'ang med //
translated: There is no other object that exists anywhere.

original: sngo sogs dag ni gang na'ang med //
analyzed: sngo sogs dag ni gang na'ang med //
translated: Blue and so on do not exist anywhere.

original: sngo sogs dag ni 'khrul pa yi //
analyzed: sngo sogs dag ni 'khrul pa yi //
translated: Blue and so on appear to

original: rnam shes la yang snang ba yin //
analyzed: rnam shes la yang snang ba yin //

original: gsal bar mdun du snang ba nyid //
analyzed: gsal bar mdun du snang ba nyid //

original: 'khrul pa'ang mthong ba min nam ci //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'ang mthong ba min nam ci //

original: de phyir gang zhig 'khrul pa las //
analyzed: de phyir gang zhig 'khrul pa las //
translated: Therefore, apart from the mistaken consciousness,

original: ma gtogs gzung ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: ma gtogs gzung ba yod ma yin //
translated: there is no object that exists.

original: ci ste yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang /
translated: If you say,

analyzed: myong ba thams cad 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni med de // 'di ltar / 'khrul pa'i sems la don byed pa //
translated: ‚ÄúAll experience is mistaken,‚Äù that is not so.üîΩThus,üîΩNothing that appears to the mistaken mind

original: 'ga' yang snang ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang snang ba yod ma yin //
translated: functions as an object.

original: de phyir 'dir ni yul med pa //
analyzed: de phyir 'dir ni yul med pa //
translated: Therefore, here the object is nonexistent,

original: 'khrul yin bzlog po gzhan du yod //
analyzed: 'khrul yin bzlog po gzhan du yod //
translated: and the mistake is the opposite of that.

original: 'de la yang brjod pa /
analyzed: 'de la yang brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: don byed myong ba de las gzhan //
analyzed: don byed myong ba de las gzhan //

original: don gyi bdag nyid yin nam ci //
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid yin nam ci //
translated: the nature of the object?

original: 'on @163b te de myong yin yang rung //
analyzed: 'on @163b te de myong yin yang rung //
translated: Or is it the experience of that?

original: de dag kun kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de dag kun kyang yod ma yin //
translated: In any case, all of that is nonexistent.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar // de yi bya ba don gzhan na //
analyzed: 'di ltar // de yi bya ba don gzhan na //
translated: The activity of that is not a different object.

original: de med pas na de med min //
analyzed: de med pas na de med min //
translated: It is not that it does not exist.üîΩ

original: 'bras bu med par 'gyur bas na //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par 'gyur bas na //
translated: But it is not the case that the cause does not exist because the effect does not exist.

original: de yang med par 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: de yang med par 'gyur ba min //
translated: And it is not the case that the effect does not exist because the cause does not exist.

original: gal te don bya ba mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med pas ni de nyid de /
analyzed: gal te don bya ba mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med pas ni de nyid de /
translated: If the effect does not exist because the activity of the object does not exist, then it is the effect that does not exist,

analyzed: med par 'gyur gyi rgyu yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ga las yin /

analyzed: gzhan med na gzhan med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would be absurd.

original: gal te 'bras bu med na 'bras bu med pa'i nus pa nyid med du chug kyang rang gi ngo bo med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu med na 'bras bu med pa'i nus pa nyid med du chug kyang rang gi ngo bo med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //

original: ci ste shes pa don bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste shes pa don bya ba yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: de nyid dam shes pa gzhan gyi /
analyzed: de nyid dam shes pa gzhan gyi /

analyzed: gal te yang skye ba'i shes pa de nyid don bya ba yin no zhe na /

analyzed: 'khrul pa la yang 'khrul pa'i shes pa yang nas yang du skye ste /

analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa skad cig gcig kho na skye bar 'gyur dgos pa ni ma yin no //

original: ci ste rig pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rig pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
